group_1.narration: —Mikura—@What a surprise, finding a story@like this buried in here.

group_1.textRight: ...A real-life tragedy that occurred in Kamihama?

group_1.textLeft: Yeah.
My eyes just happened to land on it while I was@searching through old documents.
It didn't seem to make particularly big headlines@at the time, though.
An incident long since forgotten...@"buried in history," one might say.
I wanted to know if it'd be any good as the subject@for our film project.

group_1.textRight: So it's a tragic real-life incident...
What's the story?

group_1.textLeft: Well...

group_1.narration: "It took place near the end of the Taisho era..."
"A female student happened to be engaged to@a young businessman."
"Said student was the daughter of@a once-prestigious Mizuna household,@which had since fallen into disgrace."
"Her fiancé was born in what we'd now call Kosho Ward,@and had amassed a small fortune at his young age."

group_1.textRight: ...You often find that sort of thing in books from@around that time.
Stories about "self-made men," "nouveau riche",@"social climbers".

group_1.textLeft: That's essentially it, yeah.
It was thanks to what people call the "war boom,"@which occurred several years prior.
Back then, there were tons of people who'd come@into huge fortunes within a single generation.

group_1.textRight: Wow...!

group_1.textLeft: Of course, just as many people also fell into ruin@thanks to post-war panic, disasters and so on.
But it seems that the fiancé overcame those perils,@and got his enterprise safely on track.

group_1.textRight: ...An engagement between someone like that and@a student, huh...?

group_1.textLeft: It wasn't particularly rare for female students to@get engaged, at the time.

group_1.textRight: ...During that era, only the daughters of rich@households were able to attend women's schools.
Her family must have been quite something,@disgraced or no.

group_1.textLeft: Yep. One of Mizuna's most prestigious bloodlines...@a West-side princess, in short.
And engaged to a handsome East-sider who'd@successfully started his own business, at that!
It seems to have been a very daring arrangement.
Both of your families come from Kamihama, of@course, so I'm sure you picked up on that already...

group_1.textRight: Ah, yes. Kamihama's East and West sides have@been on bad terms for ages.

group_1.textLeft: Right. But both families had their reasons for@agreeing to set up the engagement.

group_1.textRight: The disgraced West-side family had their eyes on@the money...
...And the ladder-climbing East-side family had@their eyes on the status?
Kira-senpai!@Delicately, delicately!

group_1.textLeft: ...Well, to put it bluntly, yes.

group_1.narration: "The female student wasn't very happy@with any of it at first,@seeing as it was an arranged marriage@that their parents decided upon."
"But one night, when the couple first met at a party..."
"They fell in love in the blink of an eye."

group_1.textRight: Woah!

group_1.textLeft: And maybe, just maybe... their union could resolve@the city-wide conflict that had continued for so long...
Well, that's what everyone around them was@dreaming of, at least.

group_1.textRight: A young couple falls in love, surpassing@social conflicts of the time!
A Kamihama-edition "West Side Story," if you will!
That musical is an adaptation of "Romeo and Juliet,"@in the first place.

group_1.textLeft: Now that you mention it...@They ARE the exact same story...!

group_1.textRight: You were familiar with both and still hadn't@noticed...?
...So, Komachi.@What happened next?

group_1.textLeft: Ah... um, well.
The two of them continued to rendezvous with each@other, and the marriage talks proceeded smoothly@enough...
But at one point, things took a sudden turn.
The young man actually had a childhood friend, and@they'd sworn to share their future together long ago!

group_1.textRight: [chara:303901:effect_emotion_angry_1][se:7218_anger]...RIGHT! We're going with this!

group_1.textLeft: Huh...?

group_1.textRight: I understand the basic gist!@Let's adapt this!
A based-on-a-true-story Taisho romance!@Sounds great to me!

group_1.textLeft: ...You realize I'm only half done, right?

group_1.textRight: I've heard enough already!@This subject is sure to be a hit!
All that's left is for I and our scriptwriter,@Kira-sensei, to put a nice bow on it!
I'll get right down to scouting out filming locations@and preparing the equipment...
So! Best regards, both of you!
...Off she went.

group_1.textLeft: Well, that very initiative is what got our club off@the ground in the first place!

group_1.narration: "She sought out an advisor all by herself,@got all the paperwork ready..."
"...And got them to approve our first-year budget@and spare classroom, to boot."

group_1.textRight: Yes, I admit that she's admirably driven.@And surprisingly effective, at that.

group_1.textLeft: I wonder why that is?

group_1.textRight: I imagine it's because she's leading a life where she@plays the main role.
Sorry, I'll rephrase.
It's because she's running towards her dream at@full tilt.

group_1.textLeft: ...Yeah, that tracks.
